result.execSummary:
The defendant Marco A Aguilar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To be paid at rate of $50.00 per month commencing 12/01/2015 or penalty of 2 years suspension of Driver's License.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marco A Aguilar

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marco A Aguilar in court with attorney Patricia M. Padurean.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to amend charge #2 to a county ordinance 13-102(c)(8).  Court accepts the amendment.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #2.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #2.  Count #1 is dismissed and read in.  
The Court Orders the Following to count #2:
FINE: $330.50
Total amounts due to be paid at a rate of $50.00 per month commencing 12/1/2015.  Failure to pay; the Court orders alternate sentence of 2 year driver license suspension
Defendant Marco A Aguilar in court with attorney Patricia M. Padurean.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
